page.title: 07NEW IDEAS IN FARMING
page.content: WATLING FARM. Arable & beef fattening. A herd of 100 bulls, permenately housed under the countryside safety regulations Act, fatten quickly & are ready for slaughter at 14 months. An intensive farming method. PAILTON PASTURES FARM. Once the pastureland for Pailton village. A mixed HOME FARM for their own acreage & three others they managed for the Denbeigh Estate, under a share partner -ship scheme. All the storage is here, a very large venture. The new owner came in 1967, the farmer's wife enjoys the solitary situation & busy home life. The children attend Monks Kirby schools. Main shopping expeditions are to Birmingham or Milton Keynes, the A5 trunk road seeming to form a natural barrier for business & social activities.
